• Description
  • Implementation
  • Code

BEST FIT

Best Fit is a memory management algorithm; it deals with allocating smallest free partition which meets the requirement of the requesting process.
The operating system searches the memory blocks, when the operating system finds the memory block with minimum wastage of memory, it is allocated to the process.
In Best fit memory allocation scheme, the operating system searches that can â€“

  • Accommodate the process
  • Also, leaves the minimum memory wastage

    • This method is memory efficient. The operating system allocates the job minimum possible space in the memory, making memory management very efficient. To save memory from getting wasted, it is the best method.

    COMPLEXITY

    The time complexity of Best Fit algorithm is O(n),
    where n is the number of processes.

    WORKING

    Let us consider an example.

    Memory blocks available are : {150, 350}

    Process sizes are : {300, 25, 125, 50}

    Process P1, size: 300

  • Block 1 cannot fit.

  • P1 (300) is allocated to Block 2 of size 350. 50 size is left in Block 2.


    • Process P2, size: 25

  • P2 (25) is allocated to the remaining 50 size of Block 2. 25 size is left in Block 2.


    • Process P3, size: 125

  • P3 (125) is allocated to Block 1 (150). 25 size is left in Block 1.


    • Process P4, size: 50

  • P4 (50) can't be allocated even if there is 25+25 size available.

    • // Function to allocate memory to blocks as per Best fit algorithm
function bestFit(int blockSize[], int m, int processSize[], int n)
{
  // Stores block id of the block allocated to a process
  const allocation = [];

  // Initially no block is assigned to any process
  for (let i = 0; i < allocation.length; i++)
    allocation[i] = -1;

  // pick each process and find suitable blocks according to its size ad assign to it
  for (let i=0; i < n; i++)
  {
    //Find the best fit block for current process
    let bestIdx = -1;
    for (int j=0; j < m; j++)
    {
      if (blockSize[j] >= processSize[i])
      {
        if (bestIdx == -1)
          bestIdx = j;
        else if (blockSize[bestIdx] > blockSize[j])
          bestIdx = j;
      }
    }

    // If we could find a block for current process
    if (bestIdx != -1)
    {
        // allocate block j to p[i] process
        allocation[i] = bestIdx;

        // Reduce available memory in this block.
        blockSize[bestIdx] -= processSize[i];
    }
  }
}
